com.ulflander.processors.extract
Class DocumentSplitter

java.lang.Object
  com.ulflander.processors.Processor
      com.ulflander.processors.extract.DocumentSplitter

public class DocumentSplitter
extends Processor

Processor that split a document into chapters, and paragraphs.

Since:
2/21/14
Author:
Ulflander

toChapters

public final int toChapters(Document doc)
Split a document to chapters. FOR NOW NOP SPLIT OCCURS, ANY DOCUMENT HAS ONLY ONE CHAPTER

Parameters:
doc - Document to split
Returns:
Number of tokens found in document

toParagraphs

public final int toParagraphs(Document doc,
                              Chapter chapter)
Split a chapter to paragraph and append chapter to document if there are some paragraphs.

Uses the following pattern to split chapter string: "(?<=(\r\n|\r|\n))([ \t]*$)+"

Parameters:
doc - Document being splitted
chapter - Chapter to split
Returns:
Number of tokens found in chapter

toSentences

public final int toSentences(Chapter chapter,
                             Paragraph paragraph)
Split a paragraph to sentences and append paragraph to chapter if there are some sentences.

Uses java.text.BreakIterator

Parameters:
chapter - Chapter being splitted
paragraph - Paragraph to split
Returns:
Number of tokens found in paragraph

toTokens

public final int toTokens(Paragraph paragraph,
                          Sentence sentence)
Split a sentence to tokens and append sentence to paragraph if there are some tokens.

Uses java.util.Scanner tokenization

Parameters:
paragraph - Paragraph being splitted
sentence - Sentence to split
Returns:
Number of tokens found in sentence
